topic: Mobile UI Component Library Selection for React 18 PWA

context.primary_user: Business owner on mobile phone (90% of operations)
context.critical_metric: Record sale in <30 seconds on mobile

options.name: Ant Design Mobile (antd-mobile)

mobile_components.note: Purpose-built for mobile, not desktop-first with responsive support

pros: Purpose-built for mobile (not desktop-first with responsive support)
Optimal bundle size (150-200KB fits within 400KB budget)
Rich mobile components out-of-box (bottom nav, pickers, swipe, pull-to-refresh)
Performance optimized (60fps mobile rendering, < 100ms touch response)
Free and open-source (MIT license)
Proven in Chinese enterprise mobile apps (similar ERP use cases)
React 18 ready with official support
Works out-of-box with Vite (no plugin needed)
cons: Documentation primarily Chinese (English translations available but secondary)
Smaller English community (fewer Stack Overflow answers)
No native data grid (requires custom mobile table implementation)
Design system opinionated (Ant Design style, harder to customize)
Accessibility not primary focus (less WCAG emphasis than Western libraries)

risks.mitigation: Use browser translation, community examples, Alibaba's growing English docs
Use mobile card layout (standard mobile pattern) or TanStack Table
Growing English community, GitHub issues responsive

mission_fit.alignment: Excellent - Best mobile optimization, fits bundle budget, proven in business apps

implementation_estimate.week_1: Setup antd-mobile + Vite, configure theme, build base layout
implementation_estimate.week_2: Build core mobile patterns (bottom nav, routing, auth UI)
implementation_estimate.week_3: Build POS UI, forms, lists, modals
implementation_estimate.week_4: Integrate with Django DRF APIs, implement state management

options.name: Chakra UI

mobile_components.note: Desktop-first with responsive utilities, requires custom mobile patterns

erp_components.data_tables: No native table (use TanStack Table or custom)

pros: Smallest bundle size (80-100KB, leaves maximum room for other dependencies)
Excellent developer experience (TypeScript support, headless components)
Accessibility first (WCAG AA compliant out-of-box)
Highly customizable (flexible design system)
Modern React patterns (hooks, composition, headless architecture)
Great documentation (English primary, comprehensive examples)
Active community (large English community, responsive maintainers)
Free and open-source (MIT license)
cons: Not mobile-specific (desktop-first with responsive support)
No native mobile components (no bottom nav, pickers, swipe, pull-to-refresh)
Requires additional libraries (need react-swipeable, react-virtual, etc.)
More development time (build custom mobile components, extends timeline)
No data grid (need TanStack Table or custom implementation)
Learning curve (headless pattern, composition challenging for Django developers)

risks.mitigation: Build custom in Week 2, use community packages (react-bottom-nav, etc.)
Strict sprint planning, defer non-essential features

mission_fit.alignment: Good bundle size and documentation, but requires mobile custom work

options.when_to_choose: Choose if you prioritize design flexibility and English documentation over timeline

options.name: Material-UI (MUI) v5

mobile_components.note: Desktop-first with responsive support, mobile patterns require custom work

pros: Largest ecosystem (extensive components, community support, examples)
Enterprise-grade (proven in production, professional maintenance)
Excellent documentation (comprehensive, English primary)
MUI X DataGrid (best React data grid, but heavy)
Accessibility (WCAG AA compliance, screen reader support)
TypeScript (excellent TypeScript definitions)
Community (largest React UI community, Stack Overflow answers)
Core is free (MIT license for core components)
cons: Bundle size too large (300-400KB core, DataGrid 300KB+ = exceeds budget)
Not mobile-specific (desktop-first with responsive support)
MUI X is commercial (DataGrid, DatePickers have commercial licenses)
Requires aggressive code splitting (to meet performance targets)
CSS-in-JS runtime overhead (Emotion adds ~50KB)
No native mobile patterns (no bottom nav, pickers require separate packages)

risks.mitigation: Aggressive code splitting, lazy loading, avoid MUI X
Use mobile card layout instead of grid, or lighter alternative

mission_fit.alignment: Acceptable ecosystem and components, but bundle size and mobile optimization concerns

options.when_to_choose: Choose if you prioritize ecosystem and community over bundle size and mobile optimization

options.name: Headless UI + Tailwind CSS

mobile_components.note: Build everything custom - no pre-built mobile or ERP components

erp_components.data_tables: No native table (build custom or use TanStack Table)

pros: Smallest bundle size (40KB total, maximum performance)
Complete design freedom (build exactly what you need)
Excellent performance (zero runtime CSS, fastest option)
Modern DX (TypeScript, utility-first approach)
Accessibility (Headless UI components are WCAG compliant)
No lock-in (headless components, own design system)
Active community (large, enthusiastic Tailwind community)
Free and open-source (MIT license for both libraries)
cons: Build everything custom (no pre-built mobile or ERP components)
Significantly slower development (extends 3-month timeline)
Requires design system work (must design all mobile patterns)
Higher learning curve (Tailwind + Headless UI patterns for Django developers)
No data grid (must build custom or use TanStack Table)
No mobile patterns (bottom nav, pickers, swipe - all custom)
Testing burden (must test all custom components)

mission_fit.alignment: Not recommended for timeline - build everything custom exceeds 3-month budget

options.when_to_choose: NOT recommended for 3-month timeline. Choose only if extended timeline (4-6 months) available.

rationale: Ant Design Mobile is the clear winner for this mission because it is purpose-built for mobile applications, unlike the other options which are desktop-first libraries with responsive support.
Critical for a system where 90% of operations occur on mobile phones.
Optimal bundle size (150-200KB) fits within 400KB budget, leaving room for charts and other dependencies.
Rich mobile components out-of-box (bottom nav, pickers, swipe, pull-to-refresh) save 2-3 weeks development time.
Proven in Chinese enterprise mobile apps (similar ERP use cases).
Performance optimized (60fps mobile rendering, < 100ms touch response).
tradeoffs_accepted: English documentation secondary to Chinese (mitigation: browser translation, +3-5 days)
Smaller English community (mitigation: growing community, GitHub issues responsive)
No native data grid (mitigation: mobile card layout, +3-5 days)
Opinionated design system (mitigation: theme customization, +2-3 days)

architectural.impact: Mobile-first UI architecture with bottom navigation, card-based layouts for data tables, Ant Design theme customization
architectural.changes_required: None - aligns with mission mobile-first requirements

technical.impact: React 18 + Vite 5.0+ + antd-mobile 5.x, state management (Zustand recommended), forms (antd-mobile + React Hook Form), charts (ECharts or Recharts)
technical.changes_required: Select state management, form validation library, chart library

cost.impact: None - antd-mobile is free (MIT license), within $15,000 budget

timeline.impact: +8-13 days for documentation navigation, mobile table implementation, theming (acceptable within 3-month timeline)
timeline.changes_required: Account for +8-13 days in Sprint 1-2, monitor progress

team.impact: Django developers need 2-3 weeks to learn React + antd-mobile, training focus: React hooks, antd-mobile components, state management

decision_framework.interpretation: Ant Design Mobile scores 9.17/10 (HIGH confidence, recommended), Chakra UI scores 7.63/10 (MEDIUM confidence, acceptable), Material-UI scores 6.87/10 (MEDIUM confidence, acceptable with caveats), Headless + Tailwind scores 6.01/10 (LOW confidence, not recommended for timeline)

options: Headless UI + Tailwind - Not recommended for timeline

questions_for_human.question: Timeline vs. Customization
questions_for_human.description: Do you prefer faster delivery (antd-mobile, +8-13 days) or more design control (Chakra UI, +2-3 weeks)?
questions_for_human.impact: Timeline impact varies from +8-13 days to +2-3 weeks

questions_for_human.question: Bundle Size Priority
questions_for_human.description: Is 150-200KB (antd-mobile) acceptable, or do you need 80-100KB (Chakra UI)?
questions_for_human.impact: Bundle size affects < 3 second load requirement

questions_for_human.question: Documentation Language
questions_for_human.description: Are you comfortable navigating Chinese documentation (with translation tools)?
questions_for_human.impact: English docs available but secondary for antd-mobile

questions_for_human.question: Mobile Patterns
questions_for_human.description: Do you want native mobile components out-of-box (antd-mobile) or build custom (Chakra UI, MUI)?
questions_for_human.impact: Mobile UX quality and development speed

questions_for_human.question: Ecosystem Priority
questions_for_human.description: Do you prioritize largest community (Material-UI) over mobile optimization (antd-mobile)?

human_decision_required.recommendation: Choose Ant Design Mobile for optimal balance of mobile optimization, bundle size, and development speed. Choose Chakra UI if design flexibility and English documentation are more important than timeline.

upon_approval: Lock decision as DEC-P02 in DECISIONS.md
Update ARCHITECTURE.md with UI library selection
Proceed to offline storage research (next pending task)
Create React + antd-mobile setup guide in implementation stage
Schedule 2-3 weeks Django developer training (React + antd-mobile)
if_rejected: Consider alternative (Chakra UI if design flexibility preferred, Material-UI if ecosystem prioritized)
Re-evaluate timeline if choosing Chakra UI (+2-3 weeks)
Re-evaluate bundle budget if choosing Material-UI (may exceed 5MB PWA limit)
